alert.note: Alert for Cedar; St. Clair; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 9:56PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CEDAR...WESTERN ST. CLAIR AND VERNON COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM CDT... At 956 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Schell City to 6 miles northwest of Walker to 8 miles east of Fort Scott. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Nevada, El Dorado Springs, Appleton City, Lowry City, Walker, Schell City, Moundville, Roscoe, Richards, Milo, Deerfield, Metz, Harwood, Stotesbury, Horton, Tiffin, Johnson City, Taberville and Monegaw Springs. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 83 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
